thread.title: Southwest Airlines hiring in Phoenix

author: James Aldridge
title: Southwest Airlines hiring in Phoenix
text:
Chris Rank Dallas-based Southwest Airlines Co. is looking to hire 650 workers in Albuquerque,… more Southwest Airlines is planning to hire 650 customer service representatives at its call centers in three markets, including Phoenix. The airline, which operates a major hub at Sky Harbor International Airport, is looking to hire in Phoenix, as well as Albuquerque and San Antonio, the company announced late Friday. The Dallas-based airline (NYSE: LUV) relies on its customer service reps to provide information, assist with reservations and resolving customer concerns. The new hires reflect the growth the airline is experiencing in the industry, which is contributing to additional jobs in the local economy. Interested applicants should apply at Southwest.com/careers . Southwest Airlines is a major carrier at airports in all three cities where jobs will be added. Earlier this month, Southwest Airlines reported that the company flew 10.2 billion revenue passenger miles in May 2015, which was up from the 9.4 billion miles flown in May 2014. Southwest’s Chairman, President and CEO Gary C. Kelly said the airline is on track to produce record second quarter profits.
